    • Method Detail

      • setBoundedQueue

        public void setBoundedQueue(int capacity)
        By default queue is bounded with max size equal to Enqueuer.defaultCapacity
        Parameters:
        capacity - max queue size.

      • setUnboundedQueue

        public void setUnboundedQueue()
        This option is discouraged. Most users should use bounded queues.

      • setId

        public void setId(java.lang.Object id)
        Optional user associated id.
        Parameters:
        id - must have good readable toString() representation

      • setThreadPool

        public void setThreadPool(java.util.concurrent.Executor threadPool)
        Default pool is FJP.

      • usePreallocatedQueue

        public void usePreallocatedQueue()
        Queue choice option

        This option is auto-enabled if the setBoundedQueue capacity is less than Enqueuer.smallCapacity; It makes no sense for unbounded queue case.

      • useLockFreeQueue

        public void useLockFreeQueue()
        Queue choice option

        Unbounded queue case is always lock-free, it is based on CLQ. Bounded queue case is based on LBQ or ABQ (ABQ if usePreallocatedQueue).

        If you want bounded queue to be lock-free you must

        • enable options: usePreallocatedQueue() and useLockFreeQueue()
        • include dependency: org.jctools:jctools-core:2.1.1+ dependency

      • setCustomQueue

        public void setCustomQueue(Enqueuer.QueueFactory<T> custom)
        The queue must be thread-safe and define these 3 methods: poll(), offer() and isEmpty().

        Do not use clever lock-free structures. They are not for you. For instance, most JCTools queues will not work with this library.

        Use this method only if you understand what you're doing!

      • setCustomQueue

        public void setCustomQueue(java.util.function.Supplier<? extends java.util.Queue<T>> custom)
        See Also:
        #setCustomQueue(QueueFactory)

      • setQueueWrapper

        public void setQueueWrapper(java.util.function.UnaryOperator<java.util.Queue<T>> wrapper)
        Use this method if you'd like to gather some stats e.g. max/mean q length, item arrival frequency etc. Queue wrapper creates the queue proxy, which must proxy at least these 3 methods: poll(), offer() and isEmpty()

      • disableSameThreadOptimization

        public void disableSameThreadOptimization()
        Most users should not be concerned with what this option does, the rest may read the code.
